vocab_context_data.content: _Employing subterfuge will not deceive us or weaken our resolve, Lightweaver_, the guardians said. _For indeed, this is not a matter of decision, but one of nature. The path remains closed._

vocab_entry_data.description:
An artifice or expedient used to evade a rule, escape a consequence, hide something, etc.

- subterfugio, treta

vocab_context_data.content: The room had grown quiet. Shallan shook out of her reverie and looked up to see what was happening: Ialai Sadeas had arrived at the meeting, carried in a palanquin.

vocab_context_data.content: "He was unwilling to commit," Taravangian said. "He wasn't seeking justice, but to assuage his own conscience."

The inner sense of what is right or wrong in one's conduct or motives, impelling one toward right action. Moral sense.

vocab_context_data.content: She felt its confused fascination with humankind. It remembered men—an innate understanding, much as newborn mink kits innately knew to fear the skyeel. This spren was not completely aware, not completely cognizant. She was a creation of instinct and alien curiosity, drawn to violence and pain like scavengers to the scent of blood.

vocab_entry_data.description:
Having cognizance; aware (usually followed by of).

- consciente de, percatado, estar al tanto de

Existing in one from birth; inborn; native.

- innato, inherente

vocab_context_data.content:
"Go that way," Syl said, a ribbon of light.

"Why?"

"Just listen to the piece of nature incarnate, okay? I think Father wants to apologize, in his own way."

Kaladin growled, but allowed the winds to channel him in a specific direction. He flew this way for hours, lost in the sounds of the tempest, until finally he settled down—half of his own volition, half because of the pressing winds.

vocab_entry_data.description:
The act of willing, choosing, or resolving; exercise of willing (usually preceded by of).

- volición, voluntad, intención

Embodied in flesh; given a bodily, especially a human, form.

- encarnado, personificado

vocab_context_data.content: "I can't afford to stay my hand from war," Dalinar said. "Everything you say is right, but it is also nothing new. I have never gone to battle where some poor fools on either side—men who didn't want to be there in the first place—weren't going to bear the brunt of the pain."

vocab_entry_data.description:
The main force or impact, as of an attack or blow.

- choque, embate

vocab_context_data.content: Inside the increasingly familiar vision, Dalinar carefully nocked an arrow, then released, sending a black-fletched missile into the back of the wildman. The man's screech was lost in the cacophony of battle. Ahead, men fout frantically as they were pushed backward toward the edge of a cliff.

vocab_entry_data.description:
harsh discordance of sound; dissonance

- cacofonía, disonancia

vocab_context_data.content: It used to be that they'd never speak about their pasts. That had changed, though. Skar couldn't specify exactly when. It came out, as part of the catharsis of having become something greater.

vocab_entry_data.description:
The purging of the emotions or relieving of emotional tensions, especially through certain kinds of art, as tragedy or music. 

Emotional release.

- catarsis

vocab_context_data.content:
At first, Moash plodded across the endless plains of central Alethkar, he found the sight of them encouraging. It suggested that he Voidbringers could be egalitarian. Maybe there'd simply been too few men with the strength to pull these sledges. 

Yet if that were so, why were these parshman sledge-pullers treated so poorly? The overseers did little to hide their disgust, and were allowed to whip the poor creatures without restriction.

- igualitario, persona igualitaria

A vehicle of various forms, mounted on runners and often drawn by draft animals, used for traveling or conveying loads.

- trineo, andar en trineo

vocab_context_data.content: The way he thought, breathed, even moved, implicitly conveyed that today was a day of intelligence—perhaps  not as brilliant as that single transcendent one when he'd created the Diagram, but he finally felt like himself after so many days trapped in the mausoleum of his own flesh, his mind like a master painter allowed only to whitewash walls.

large family tomb

An effigy, image, or representation.

Of or relating to the most perfect embodiment of something. A prime example.

- por excelencia, por antonomasia, prototípico

vocab_context_data.content: The storm was a primal dance, an ancient song, an eternal battle that had raged since Roshar was new. It wanted to be used. - consentir, acceder, someterse

- vindicar a, justificar a, justificar

The Blackthorn was crying as he cradled the gemstone.

Small; little; tiny.

- diminuto, minúsculo, pequeñito

vocab_context_data.content: Veden lighteyes were chatting and drinking wine. A low wall on the eastern side here allowed for the growth of all kinds of rare plants in a jumble, which was the curent horticultural fashion. Lifespren bobbed among them.
